benchmark_details.name: MIRA NEWS: Dataset and Benchmarks for Multi-Resource-Assisted News Summarization
benchmark_details.overview: MIRA NEWS introduces a new task, Multi-Resource-Assisted News summarization, along with a novel dataset that collects multiple assisting news articles to mitigate extrinsic hallucinations in single-document summarization.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset and benchmark for evaluating the effectiveness of multi-resource-assisted news summarization.

data.source: Collected from newser.com, which aggregates news articles with assisting documents.
data.annotation: Automatically collected and structured data from news articles.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on generated summaries compared to ground truth summaries, and the presence of extrinsic facts is assessed using SFweights.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ROUGE scores indicate better alignment with human-authored summaries, while SFweights scores indicate lower levels of extrinsic hallucinations.
methodology.baseline_results: BART and HT models with various configurations show varying performance on benchmark tasks.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated by comparing to baseline results and human-authored summaries.
